cards.name: Riley Park
cards.description: Riley Park is an eleven-acre park featuring lighted asphalt walking trails, a large covered picnic pavilion, restrooms, park benches, picnic tables, and barbecue pits. The park is traversed by Berry Creek and includes the historic abandoned Santa Fe Railroad Bridge from 1887.

cards.name: Dane Park
cards.description: Dane Park is a five-acre park home to Austin Haley’s Splash Pad. The park's master plan includes a lighted walking trail, community garden area, picnic tables, a skateboard facility, a pavilion, and restrooms.

cards.name: Austin’s Big Splash
cards.description: Opened in 2007, Austin’s Big Splash is a 5,000-square-foot splash pad featuring state-of-the-art nozzles that spray water when activated. The facility is open during the summer months and offers a fun water recreation experience for all ages.

cards.name: Kenneth L. King Park
cards.description: Kenneth L. King Park is a twenty-acre nature park featuring a one-mile hard-surface, lighted walking trail, restrooms, a pavilion, paved parking, and an 18-hole disc golf course. The park is heavily wooded, offering a rustic setting for visitors.

cards.name: Timberlake Rose Rock Museum
cards.description: The Timberlake Rose Rock Museum showcases Oklahoma's state rock, the rose rock. Visitors can explore a variety of specimens, including massive clusters, and learn about the geological history of these unique formations.

cards.name: Noble Scaregrounds
cards.description: Noble Scaregrounds offers a haunting experience with attractions like the 'Sweet Nightmares Trail' and 'The Séance.' Open during October, it provides thrilling entertainment, including axe throwing and themed food at 'The Gut Hut.'

cards.name: Rose Rock Music Festival
cards.description: Held annually on the first weekend in May, the Rose Rock Music Festival celebrates Noble's designation as the Rose Rock Capital of the World. The festival features a parade, live music, food vendors, craft booths, and a carnival.

cards.name: Sam Noble Museum
cards.description: Located in nearby Norman, the Sam Noble Museum offers exhibits on Oklahoma's natural history, including dinosaur skeletons, Native American artifacts, and interactive displays for all ages.
